thread.title: Super Bowl: 'Hamilton' stars add 'sisterhood' to 'America the Beautiful'
thread.title_full: Super Bowl: 'Hamilton' stars add 'sisterhood' to 'America the Beautiful'

author: USA TODAY
title: Super Bowl: 'Hamilton' stars add 'sisterhood' to 'America the Beautiful'
text:
Super Bowl: 'Hamilton' stars add 'sisterhood' to 'America the Beautiful' Carly Mallenbaum , USA TODAY 8:02 p.m. ET Feb. 5, 2017 
Jasmine Cephas Jones (from left), Renee Elise Goldsberry and Phillipa Soo of 'Hamilton' sing 'America the Beautiful' prior to the Super Bowl. (Photo: Al Bello, Getty Images) 
It makes sense that the singers known for playing the Schuyler sisters on Broadway would add a lyric about "sisterhood." 
Ahead of Super Bowl 51, original Hamilton actresses Phillipa Soo, Renée Elise Goldsberry and Jasmine Cephas Jones sang America the Beautiful with one small lyrical tweak: Their version went "And crown thy good with brotherhood ... and sisterhood." 
Yep, those last two words aren't in the original tune. Instead, they're a feminist addition that the singers themselves suggested adding ( according to Alex Lacamoire , who arranged the song). #Hamilton 's Schuyler Sisters (Phillipa Soo, Renée Elise Goldsberry, Jasmine Cephas Jones) slay "America The Beautiful" #SuperBowl pic.twitter.com/I4BtzUrvQw — Jarett Wieselman (@JarettSays) February 5, 2017 
And Twitter took note.
